result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven John Kramer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment, to be within 60 days of release from jail on Case 15CF135
--installation of Sobrieter for first 60 days after release from jail on Case 15CF135, then per Agent
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--any other assessment, treatment or counseling per agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

Arresting Agency: FAPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF135 and 15CF159 called together at 8:12am [mo]
Defendant Steven John Kramer in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Case 15CF135:
ADA Hall motions to amend Count #1 to remove all modifiers and enhancers
--The Court grants the motion to amend Count #1

As to Both Cases:
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Case 15CF135 without enhancers and modifiers & 15CF159; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 

On Case 15CF159:

The Court IMPOSES & STAYS  12 months jail with Huber privileges and places Mr. Kramer  on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
, to be within 60 days of release from jail on Case 15CF135
--installation of Sobrieter for first 60 days after release from jail on Case 15CF135, then per Agent
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--any other assessment, treatment or counseling per agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge

Day credit for time already served: 0 days

On Case 15CF135:

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443, Costs are to be converted to civil judgement against Mr. Kramer in favor of State/County

Days credit for time already served:  0  days

The Court determines that Mr. Kramer has previously given a DNA sample and does not order Mr. Kramer to submit another in either case. 
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibition warnings given
recess:8:46

Cases 15CF135 and 15CF159 called together at 10:19am [mo]
Defendant Steven John Kramer in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance in both files

As to both Cases:
Mr. Kramer waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial in each matter.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted in both cases, reading waived
 as to both
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
 on both cases

Atty. Humes requests a Plea and Sentencing date out 3 weeks.
recess: 10:30am 


NEXT:   Plea and Sentencing for both Cases: 8/17/2015 at 8:10am

Cases 15CF135 and 15CF159 called together at 9:34am [mo]
Defendant Steven John Kramer in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights in file 15CF159

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County Assistant/District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised/ADA Wambach did prosecute Mr. Kramer. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.


As to Case 15CF135(Initial Appearacne and Motion Hearing occur):
The Court verifies Mr. Kramer's date of birth and address on file
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

On the State's 6/5/2015 Motion to Modify Bond in Case 15CF135:
Atty. Humes verifies reciept
The Court reviews the Court Record
Atty. Humes indicates that Mr. Kramer is already on Scram Monitoring for Case 15CF159 and Mr. Kramer does not object to this condition applying to 15CF135 also
Arguments as to bond modification given by DA Happ; DA Happ orallly motions for the cash bond to be forfeit and set a high signature bond
The Court finds the $150 cash bond in Case 15CF135 to be in default and orders it forfeit


The Court requires a $ 1000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--No consumption of alcohol
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Troy or Sue Fullerton
-The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.


As to Case 15CF159(Status Conference):
The Court directs the Clerk to remove the 6/15/15 Status Conference from the calendar, as this case will share a new status date with 15CF135

recess: 9:57am

NEXT: (1)Pretrial Conference: July 8, 2015 at 9:40am  (2)Status Conference: July 21, 2015 at 10:30am

Case called at 1:29 pm [sf]
Defendant Steven John Kramer in custody, in person with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that the Defendant qualifies for SPD.
Address and DOB information verified.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or package houses
-The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on today, WCS to install at the jail.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Attorney De La Rosa requests that this case track with 15CF135 and requests this case be set for a status on 6/22/15 when 15CF135 is set for initial appearance.
Court will set this case on for a status on 6/22/15.

Recess: 1:35 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Status: 6/22/15 at 10:00 am ( this is to track with 15CF135 which is set for initial in Branch 2 on 6/22/15)
